ai.summary: A 12.7 km circular hike around Cliveden estate in Buckinghamshire, combining woodland tracks, riverfront paths and manicured grounds. Moderate difficulty with gentle climbs; typically 3–4 hours at a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-marked gravel trails and woodland footpaths, with occasional grass sections. Expect gentle ascents and a few steps; surfaces are firm but can be muddy after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check National Trust opening status before visiting; stay on marked trails; wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing; carry water and snacks; surfaces can be slippery when wet; be mindful of ticks in wooded areas; supervise dogs where allowed and keep them under control; be cautious near river edges.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing and a waterproof jacket
Map or GPS device (or offline map on phone)
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn are ideal for scenery and comfortable conditions; the trail is hikeable year-round with appropriate gear.

seo.title: Cliveden Gold Walking Trail – 12.7 km Moderate Hike in Cliveden, UK
